Alex | 17 | She/Her |
Welcome to my messy blog! I'm just an introverted girl who spends too much time on the internet.

summary: Hi guys!
body:
Hi guys!

So I’ve been feeling awful latley and I was thinking maybe I could talk to someone. I don’t have any internet friend and I’d love to make some here so if anyone would like to have a chat feel free to message me :)

.

.

summary: What did they order? Were they with other people or was it just two of them?
question: What did they order? Were they with other people or was it just two of them?
answer: All I can tell you they ordered for sure is that weird pudding ball featured on phil’s insta story. I also could not tell you if they were with anyone else, because I don’t know.

blog.name: pmlxdjh
blog.title: ☞ № ☜
blog.description:
lauren | 16 | phillie | ii 17/05/18

dan and phil taking over my life since 2013

summary: Heyyyyy, about what you said about Dans channel- I agree to an extent but I think he’s taking care of himself- not giving...
question: Heyyyyy, about what you said about Dans channel- I agree to an extent but I think he’s taking care of himself- not giving himself the emotional stress of having to film a video. Videos on the gaming channel don’t require much effort as they can just play a game, but Dan probably wants to put as much effort as possible into a video. I can see where your coming from though. (Please don’t hate me I’m shy) Yeet 💕
answer:
nah i understand where you are coming from with this. I know people are saying it’s because of his mental health which is of course okay in all circumstances, however i feel as if he’s kinda pushed away his channel and is dedicated to gaming and phil?

I think people need to stop pushing everything dan does too his depression. y’all are literally turning it into a thing where dan can be let off any scenario because of it. dan literally said himself that he doesn’t let it define him. i am not forcing him to produce a video but i just think, he can wholeheartedly create a video for his channel whilst on tour. if he can make videos with phil, then surely he can make videos for himself?

idk, people have been hating on me since i posted the thing about his channel, and people have been saying that no one thinks that and it’s up to him. of course it’s up to him, but come off it, i’ve seen everyone with their ‘where is dans june video?’ and ‘dans appeared on phils channel more than his own this year’ posts. don’t deny it to make yourself seem like some saint. you’re allowed to have an opinion.


didn’t y’all learn anything from dans channel?

didn’t y’all learn anything from dans channel?

summary: Regarding your unpopular opinion post: I thought I was the only one who noticed that sometimes their videos (gaming videos)...
question: Regarding your unpopular opinion post: I thought I was the only one who noticed that sometimes their videos (gaming videos) seemed off. I’m not saying their gaming videos are scripted (it’d be kind of hard to do that) but it’s not very genuine? And it kind of feels like phil is waiting for a queue to say something? Idk maybe I’m overthinking. Anyway, I do agree with your opinion so know you’re not alone :)
answer:
Exactly! Like don’t get me wrong I love Dan and Phil and the content they make, but I feel like they’re some of the only remaining youtubers who are kind of stuck in their “branding”. Their videos never feel totally genuine because I feel like there’s always some degree of acting.

Obviously they’re also just very private people and there are things they never plan to share, and that’s cool! And I know they’ve both started being way more open the last couple years. But I think they could both really benefit from a Jenna or Shane style rebrand where they just stop giving any fucks and make whatever they want and act however they want.

!!! READ THE FAQ BEFORE SENDING ME AN ASK !!!

Mobile Links

This blog is autoposts anything that gets put in the Dan Howell/Phil Lester tag on Archive of Our Own (AO3).

Sometimes the applet on IFTT I use straight up breaks. I don't recommend turning on notifications for this blog. Links don't work on mobile.

Admin: Ozzy (foolishdeadbeat)

summary: the city spins around
title: the city spins around
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2LuMD6y

by dizzy

But by Vancouver they’ve had days of rest, and Phil’s still just… tired. He sleeps harder, longer, and feels less rested. He wakes up in the night sometimes feeling stiff and Dan can hear him pacing around the front room of their hotel suite.

blog.description:
there is a voice inside of you
that whispers all day long
i feel that this is right for me
i know that this is wrong
no teacher preacher parent friend
or wise man can decide
what's right for you - just listen to
the voice that speaks inside
- shel silverstein

Mandy. 30s.
Scifi fan, youtube fan, puppy fan.
RPF heavy blog.

Don't be a dick. :)

summary: the city spins around rating: pg word count: 888 summary: But by the time Vancouver comes to an end they've had days of rest,...
body:
the city spins around
rating: pg
word count: 888
summary: But by the time Vancouver comes to an end they’ve had days of rest, and Phil’s still just… tired. He sleeps harder, longer, and feels less rested.
notes: written for @phandomficfests​​ Fic You’re Afraid to Write flash fest. 
warning: non-terminal illness

[read on ao3]

It starts as a series of little annoyances.

*

The frequent middle of the night interruptions. Dan gets used to hearing Phil get up on the tour bus. He thinks it’s just Phil being restless, thinks Phil can’t sleep well on the bus and wants to stretch his legs.

But in a hotel room Dan still wakes to the bed dipping beside him. He rolls half over, slinging an arm over his eyes. “What…?”

“Need a wee,” Phil says. He sounds as sleepy as Dan feels.

Dan’s breathing evens back out in the time he’s gone, but something lingers near the front of his mind. “Didn’t you already-”

“Had to again.” Phil crawls back under the covers, leaning in so his forehead is pressed against Dan’s arm. “Sorry for waking you up.”

Dan reaches out and pats his arm. “’s ok.”

*

The thump when Phil takes a knee hard on the stairs going down to a dressing room.

“Shit,” he says, a stunned curse.

“You okay?” Dan turns to look behind him. A frown draws at his mouth and he holds a hand out to help Phil up.

“Leg fell asleep. Or… something.”

“Doesn’t that only happen when you’ve been sitting on it?”

Phil shrugs.

He’s shaking just a little.

*

The trip to Australia - Phil’s exhausted before they even start. Something settles into his skin around the end of July and it doesn’t leave. Phil says he’s just older this go around, with a bite of resigned resentment.

But by Vancouver they’ve had days of rest, and Phil’s still just… tired. He sleeps harder, longer, and feels less rested. He wakes up in the night sometimes feeling stiff and Dan can hear him pacing around the front room of their hotel suite.

Phil gets angry when Dan comes to check on him. It’s a role reversal from old fights, old tensions, and Dan’s not sure what to do from this side of it.

He watches Phil on the plane ride over the ocean and tells himself they just need more down time scheduled in.

*

It’s morning and Dan’s on his laptop, checking emails while Phil sleeps beside him. He doesn’t realize Phil’s awake until Phil says, “Dan.” in a quiet but terrified voice.

“What- when did you wake up?” He almost laughs but he sees the look on Phil’s face and the sound dies before it leaves his throat. “What’s wrong?”

“My eyes,” Phil says.

“Put your fucking glasses on,” Dan says, still trying to be casual about it.

Phil just shakes his head. “It’s not that. It’s not the same. Everything’s doubled.”

Dan sits up with him for the next hour, arms around Phil.

Phil’s vision clears eventually but he’s is quiet and withdrawn the rest of the day.

That night he confesses that it’s happened before.

*

Australia comes and goes.

They only talk about it when it’s the two of them.

Dan tries to talk Phil into seeing a doctor, but he won’t overseas.

“The tour’s almost over,” he always says. “I’m fine.”

And he is - mostly.

Except for the circles under his eyes, and the way he has to walk more slowly and concentrate more carefully, and the times no one sees Dan reach out to steady him.

There aren’t as many nights out. There aren’t as many grand tourist adventures. But Phil doesn’t stumble much on stage and every fan gets their hug and one by one the days slip by.

Then they’re home, and the excuses run out.

*

The diagnosis comes slowly. The first doctor sends him to a neurologist. The neurologist schedules appointment after appointment. He gets his blood drawn a few times. There’s an MRI, a spinal tap that Dan holds his hand through. Everything is done discreetly and professionally and on as expedient a timetable as the medical professionals will allow.

The words are thrown around for ages before it becomes a definitive.

Multiple sclerosis.

*

“I’m not going to die,” Phil says.

They’re in the back of a taxi after another appointment.

Dan’s holding his hand.

They hold hands a lot more now. Dan has the constant urge to reach out and touch, to have Phil near. It’s partially because the touch seems to soothe some of the tension in Phil and partially just so Dan can remind himself of what Phil just reminded them both of out loud.

Dan bites back the tried and true response of everybody dies. That’s not what Phil wants to hear right now. That’s not the person Dan wants to be right now. There’s too much real emotion choking at him. “You’re not,” he agrees.

They were both afraid, though they didn’t talk about it much. This is bad, but it’s not the worst. There are so many other things it could have been, so many things Dan saw during his four am internet spirals. They’ll process this. They’ll make a plan. They’ve got numbers to call, people to speak to. They’ll figure it out.

When Dan looks over he sees Phil crying. He knows every kind of cry Phil has, and he knows that this is neither happy nor sad. Phil’s overwhelmed, and that’s okay. He’ll process it in his own way. For now, Dan just holds his hand and sends out a quiet plea of gratitude to the skies.

It’s gonna be okay.
body_abstract:
the city spins around
rating: pg
word count: 888
summary: But by the time Vancouver comes to an end they’ve had days of rest, and Phil’s still just… tired. He sleeps harder, longer, and feels less rested.
notes: written for @phandomficfests​​ Fic You’re Afraid to Write flash fest. 
warning: non-terminal illness

[read on ao3]

There are so many other things it could have been, so many things Dan saw during his four am internet spirals. They’ll process this. They’ll make a plan. They’ve got numbers to call, people to speak to. They’ll figure it out.

When Dan looks over he sees Phil crying. He knows every kind of cry Phil has, and he knows that this is neither happy nor sad. Phil’s overwhelmed, and that’s okay. He’ll process it in his own way. For now, Dan just holds his hand and sends out a quiet plea of gratitude to the skies.

It’s gonna be okay.

trail.content_raw:
the city spins around
rating: pg
word count: 888
summary: But by the time Vancouver comes to an end they’ve had days of rest, and Phil’s still just… tired. He sleeps harder, longer, and feels less rested.
notes: written for @phandomficfests​​ Fic You’re Afraid to Write flash fest. 
warning: non-terminal illness

[read on ao3]

[[MORE]]

It starts as a series of little annoyances.

*

The frequent middle of the night interruptions. Dan gets used to hearing Phil get up on the tour bus. He thinks it’s just Phil being restless, thinks Phil can’t sleep well on the bus and wants to stretch his legs.

But in a hotel room Dan still wakes to the bed dipping beside him. He rolls half over, slinging an arm over his eyes. “What…?”

“Need a wee,” Phil says. He sounds as sleepy as Dan feels.

Dan’s breathing evens back out in the time he’s gone, but something lingers near the front of his mind. “Didn’t you already-”

“Had to again.” Phil crawls back under the covers, leaning in so his forehead is pressed against Dan’s arm. “Sorry for waking you up.”

Dan reaches out and pats his arm. “’s ok.”

*

The thump when Phil takes a knee hard on the stairs going down to a dressing room.

“Shit,” he says, a stunned curse.

“You okay?” Dan turns to look behind him. A frown draws at his mouth and he holds a hand out to help Phil up.

“Leg fell asleep. Or… something.”

“Doesn’t that only happen when you’ve been sitting on it?”

Phil shrugs.

He’s shaking just a little.

*

The trip to Australia - Phil’s exhausted before they even start. Something settles into his skin around the end of July and it doesn’t leave. Phil says he’s just older this go around, with a bite of resigned resentment.

But by Vancouver they’ve had days of rest, and Phil’s still just… tired. He sleeps harder, longer, and feels less rested. He wakes up in the night sometimes feeling stiff and Dan can hear him pacing around the front room of their hotel suite.

Phil gets angry when Dan comes to check on him. It’s a role reversal from old fights, old tensions, and Dan’s not sure what to do from this side of it.

He watches Phil on the plane ride over the ocean and tells himself they just need more down time scheduled in.

*

It’s morning and Dan’s on his laptop, checking emails while Phil sleeps beside him. He doesn’t realize Phil’s awake until Phil says, “Dan.” in a quiet but terrified voice.

“What- when did you wake up?” He almost laughs but he sees the look on Phil’s face and the sound dies before it leaves his throat. “What’s wrong?”

“My eyes,” Phil says.

“Put your fucking glasses on,” Dan says, still trying to be casual about it.

Phil just shakes his head. “It’s not that. It’s not the same. Everything’s doubled.”

Dan sits up with him for the next hour, arms around Phil.

Phil’s vision clears eventually but he’s is quiet and withdrawn the rest of the day.

That night he confesses that it’s happened before.

*

Australia comes and goes.

They only talk about it when it’s the two of them.

Dan tries to talk Phil into seeing a doctor, but he won’t overseas.

“The tour’s almost over,” he always says. “I’m fine.”

And he is - mostly.

Except for the circles under his eyes, and the way he has to walk more slowly and concentrate more carefully, and the times no one sees Dan reach out to steady him.

There aren’t as many nights out. There aren’t as many grand tourist adventures. But Phil doesn’t stumble much on stage and every fan gets their hug and one by one the days slip by.

Then they’re home, and the excuses run out.

*

The diagnosis comes slowly. The first doctor sends him to a neurologist. The neurologist schedules appointment after appointment. He gets his blood drawn a few times. There’s an MRI, a spinal tap that Dan holds his hand through. Everything is done discreetly and professionally and on as expedient a timetable as the medical professionals will allow.

The words are thrown around for ages before it becomes a definitive.

Multiple sclerosis.

*

“I’m not going to die,” Phil says.

They’re in the back of a taxi after another appointment.

Dan’s holding his hand.

They hold hands a lot more now. Dan has the constant urge to reach out and touch, to have Phil near. It’s partially because the touch seems to soothe some of the tension in Phil and partially just so Dan can remind himself of what Phil just reminded them both of out loud.

Dan bites back the tried and true response of everybody dies. That’s not what Phil wants to hear right now. That’s not the person Dan wants to be right now. There’s too much real emotion choking at him. “You’re not,” he agrees.

They were both afraid, though they didn’t talk about it much. This is bad, but it’s not the worst. There are so many other things it could have been, so many things Dan saw during his four am internet spirals. They’ll process this. They’ll make a plan. They’ve got numbers to call, people to speak to. They’ll figure it out.

When Dan looks over he sees Phil crying. He knows every kind of cry Phil has, and he knows that this is neither happy nor sad. Phil’s overwhelmed, and that’s okay. He’ll process it in his own way. For now, Dan just holds his hand and sends out a quiet plea of gratitude to the skies.

It’s gonna be okay.

Phil is a senior in college who swore his first semester of his senior year he wouldn’t get involved sexually or romantically with a freshman. Too bad a certain freshman, Dan Howell, is a lot more persistent then he ever expected a one-time-exception fling to be.
